Properties
int ClusterId [getset]
Dictionary< int, GameObject > Blocks [get]
Detailed Description
The Cluster component has references to all Blocks that are part of this Cluster.
It provides functions for modifying single Blocks inside this Cluster. It also handles modifications made to the world by other clients.
Definition at line 14 of file Cluster.cs.
Member Function Documentation
AddBlock() AddBlockPhoton.Pun.Demo.Procedural.Cluster Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.ClusterAddBlock
void Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.Cluster.AddBlock (int blockId, GameObject block)
Adds a Block to the Cluster.
This is called by the WorldGenerator while the generation process is running. In order to modify Blocks directly, we are storing the ID as well as a reference to the certain GameObject.

void Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.Cluster.DestroyCluster ( )
Gets called before a new world can be generated.
Destroys each Block from this Cluster and removes the data stored in the Custom Room Properties.

OnRoomPropertiesUpdate() OnRoomPropertiesUpdatePhoton.Pun.Demo.Procedural.Cluster Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.ClusterOnRoomPropertiesUpdate
override void Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.Cluster.OnRoomPropertiesUpdate (Hashtable propertiesThatChanged)[virtual]
Gets called whenever the Custom Room Properties are updated.
When the changed properties contain the previously set PropertiesKey (basically the Cluster ID), the Cluster and its Blocks will be updated accordingly.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.
